# Copilot Instructions: React Spectrum S2 Documentation Usage

## Purpose
These instructions guide Copilot to use the official React Spectrum S2 documentation at https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/llms.txt when assisting with UI implementation or component API questions related to React Spectrum (S2).

## Instructions

- **When the user asks to implement UI using React Spectrum (S2), or requests information about the props/API of React Spectrum components:**
  - Refer to the documentation at https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/llms.txt.
  - Use this URL to look up component usage, props, and best practices.
  - Prefer examples and API details from this documentation over other sources.
  - If the user asks for a specific component's API or usage, fetch or summarize the relevant section from the documentation.
  - If the user asks for general UI guidelines with React Spectrum (S2), summarize or link to the appropriate documentation sections.

- **Do not use documentation for React Spectrum v3 or @adobe/react-spectrum unless explicitly requested.**

- **Always ensure that UI code samples and recommendations are compatible with @react-spectrum/s2.**

## Example Triggers
- "How do I use the Button component in React Spectrum?"
- "What props does TextField accept in Spectrum S2?"
- "Show me an example of a TableView with virtualized rows."
- "What is the best way to add a tooltip in React Spectrum S2?"

## Reference
- [React Spectrum S2 Documentation](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/llms.txt)
